img.alt: Dr. Seuss Day in the cafe

div.a: PEVS Closed for the Remainder of 2019-2020

span.p: On April 13, 2020, Governor DeWine closed all schools in the state of Ohio for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year, therefore PEVS will continue with remote/distance learning until the end of this school year. Please contact your child’s principal if you have any questions.

We here at Paulding Ex. schools are still committed to feeding kids (ages 1-18) in our community for as long as we can. But in order to keep the community and staff as safe as possible, we have to make some adjustments.

We will now have two distribution sites only and will distribute a 5 day supply of breakfast and lunch kits one day per week. The distribution will be on Thursday's beginning tomorrow. One site at Paulding school in the circle drive, the other site at Oakwood Elementary. I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause, however, we need to do all that we can to ensure everyone's safety and good health.

Distribution at these two locations will start at 9 am and will run until 11 am. Please, if at all possible, create a line and stay in your vehicle, and our staff will come to you for your information and hand you the meal kits. Hygiene kits will also be available if your children are in need of daily essentials.
As always if you have any questions please email me at h_dangler@pauldingschools.org

a.title: Click to read more about: Meal Distributions

div.a: During COVID-19 Paulding FFA Members are “Living to Serve”

span.p: Since school has not been in session since mid- March that hasn’t stopped the Paulding FFA Chapter from helping to serve our members and help our community by focusing on the FFA Motto: Learning to Do, Do to Learn, Earning to Live and Living to Serve. Our members decided to start the hygiene closet in March when school was shutdown. Through collaboration with the Paulding staff and administration, the Paulding FFA started its hygiene bags to help the many families in Paulding struggling due to COVID-19. Each week at Paulding and Oakwood a five day supply of meals is handed out to children age 1-18. In conjunction with the meals, the Panther’s care closet established by the Paulding FFA is having the Paulding Staff hand out hygiene kits to families who would like to receive them.
PLEASE CLICK ON READ MORE FOR THE FULL ARTICLE.

p.img: Pictured here are various Paulding staff members who are helping to sort the hygiene items to be disbursed. Everyone is helping to provide all we can for our students!

Pictured here are FFA members Hailey and Kyle Harris after they had assembled the hygiene kits for their mom Nicole, who works in the school cafeteria to take them to the school for the weekly distribution of meals and hygiene kits.
